summary: An FBI intake document recording a phone call from a nurse who cared for Jeffrey Epstein at the Surrey Hotel in Manhattan in August or September 2000. The caller, a nursing professor, reported having 'significant information' about Epstein and witnessing Ghislaine Maxwell visit him, but cited HIPAA concerns for not reporting sooner. She requested an in-person meeting with law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI intake report; the nurse caller stated she cared for him at the Surrey Hotel in Manhattan in August or September 2000.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Reported by the nurse caller to have visited Jeffrey Epstein while he was under her care at the Surrey Hotel.

connections.description: Maxwell visited Epstein while he was staying at the Surrey Hotel and under the care of the nurse caller.
Epstein was visited by Maxwell while he was a patient at the Surrey Hotel.

events.title: Epstein's Stay at Surrey Hotel
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein stayed at the Surrey Hotel in Manhattan, NY, and was cared for by a nurse for at least a 24-hour period. During this time, Ghislaine Maxwell visited him.

events.title: FBI Intake Call
events.description: A nurse (and nursing professor) called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information about caring for Jeffrey Epstein in 2000 and witnessing Ghislaine Maxwell visit him.

keyFacts: A nurse cared for Jeffrey Epstein for at least 24 hours during his stay at the Surrey Hotel in Manhattan in August or September 2000.
The nurse reported that Ghislaine Maxwell visited Epstein during this period of care.
The caller, a nursing professor, stated she had 'significant information' that could 'help' the district attorney's office but wanted to speak in person.
The caller cited being bound by HIPAA guidelines as the reason for not reporting the information about Epstein sooner.
The FBI intake was created on November 16, 2021, based on a call received at 11:35 a.m. Eastern Time.
